How to Install podracer on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • podracer

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install podracer on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing podracer on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall podracer in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install podracer, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install podracer Using apt

To install podracer in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install podracer using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install podracer

The installation of podracer might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install podracer Using apt-get

To install podracer using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install podracer.

sudo apt-get -y install podracer

Install podracer Using Synaptic

To install podracer using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install podracer on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for podracer. This will display the podracer package in the package window, now to install podracer, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the podracer package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of podracer.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install podracer Using aptitude

To install podracer on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of podracer.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install podracer using the command aptitude install podracer.

sudo aptitude -y install podracer

How to Upgrade podracer on debian

If you want to upgrade the podracer package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade podracer using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade podracer to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade podracer.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade podracer sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade podracer

Upgrade podracer using Aptitude

To upgrade podracer using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade podracer.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade podracer

Upgrade podracer using Synaptic

To upgrade podracer using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for podracer, now right-click podracer, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade podracer just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall podracer on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall podracer from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just podracer, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove podracer

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of podracer

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of podracer you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge podracer

Remove podracer using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall podracer using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for podracer, right-click the podracer package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall podracer click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install podracer on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade podracer using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of podracer then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
